instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: A820-00244 no voltage or amp draw from charger
threads.message: Hi ive got an A820-00244 no voltage or amp draw from charger i have tried different charging ports with no change . Diode reading on both sides of F3050 is 590 so i dont think theres a short , i thought i should at least get 5v there ? , im a bit lost where to start with this one

threads.title: A820-00244 no voltage or amp draw from charger
threads.message:
5V detection is done through CC1/2 lines.
Check diode mode there.
Also check at LDOs of <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip.

threads.title: A820-00244 no voltage or amp draw from charger
threads.message: both cc1/2 lines are dead short to ground and ldo lines are both 530 in diode mode , would i be right in thinking the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip is shorted ?

threads.title: A820-00244 no voltage or amp draw from charger
threads.message:
Usually <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> problem.
Low chance to be <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>/02.

threads.title: A820-00244 no voltage or amp draw from charger
